name: Palazzo Squarcialupi

reviews.text: Normally stay in one of the apartments down by the vineyard but this time stayed in the hotel for only the second time with our parents and our daughter. The hotel is absolutely beautiful, beautifully decorated, really managing to hold on to the history of the Palace but at the same time providing all the modern amenities that you need, air con, wifi etc. They have recently replaced the mattresses on the beds and they are incredibly comfortable. We have got to know Irene in the hotel over the years and she is an absolute star, nothing is too much bother for her and she always goes just that extra wee bit for you. Would happily recommend this hotel to anyone and the rates are very reasonable. Thanks and hopefully see you soon. :)
reviews.title: Always Amazing

reviews.text: We have stayed here two years ago and actually got engaged on the terrace overlooking the chianti vineyards.
reviews.title: Excellent our favourite hotel ever

reviews.text: This year we stayed here again and it was even more special this time round The staff are very friendly and treated us like royalty. The rooms are beautiful. The pool and spa area is 5 Star and the breakfast is great.
reviews.title: Superb staff, rooms and facilities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We can't wait to make a return visit ASAP.
reviews.title: A chance to stay in a historic building in the heart of Tuscany.

reviews.text: We stayed here after a nightmare stay in Florence, and the hotel could not have been better. Amazing huge period rooms (we were in 525 I think) renovated recently with exposed beams, a huge bathroom and sofas to lounge around on. The staff were super efficient, (even walking to restaurants to make bookings when the phones were busy!) and really helpful, the pool is small but ideal for cooling off when you get tired of walking around the very nice lttle towns. The added bonus of wine tasting rooms either side of the property is the icing on the cake. We paid £118 Euros for non-view rooms, I gather the upgrade was worth it, but we spent the extra on the super wines they have on offer. They sell very good local wines at around 12 - 15 Euros a bottle and you can sip the Chianti on the balcony with views over the vineyards. Perfect. Highly recommend this place.
reviews.title: I agree with everyone this was a standout for our Italy trip

reviews.text: Travelled with friends.... no car... great location... very helpful staff... would highly recommend, fantastic spa, great rooms... only downside was breakfast but absoloutley everything else perfect and plenty of places nearby for food and drink. If you are not driving this is a great place location wise
reviews.title: perfection!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a wonderful time. The scenes from our room and outside balcony were glorious; the service excellent. Kudos and gracias to Arlene and staff.
reviews.title: Palazzo Squarcialupi was superb!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here last week for 3 nights. On the first night we stayed in a standard "superior " room on the 2nd floor. Huge, wonderful 15ft ceilings, sunrise view from heaven and frat house furnishings with a back aching mattress that should have been donated years ago. I gave the 18" TV away 15 years ago, how did it appear here? The swinging shower door leaked so spent 30 min sopping up the water. It was across from the breakfast room so good luck sleeping past 7am,when they start preparing breakfast. We paid 135euro for this room
reviews.title: The palazzo was amazing but the furnishings beat up

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent the next two nights on the 3rd floor in a standard room that was almost the same size as the more expensive one yet priced at 115 euro/ night. Same beat up furnishings and lumpier mattress but overlooked the street with it's night noise. The common rooms are wonderful with a palace sized living room and another computer room on the 2nd floor. You will spend alot of time here because the WiFI does not receive in the bedroom-thick walls and all. The Palazzo was well restored and maintained its architectural features, a joy to explore.
reviews.title: Perfect Stay

reviews.text: The breakfast was above average and plentiful with a crackerjack staff, the housekeepers efficient and spotless and the two older, disinterested receptionists most unpleasant and lazy.They have a bizarre 2 hour "terrorist " limit to the internet connection that -while free- was begrudging dispensed by these sourpusses.The 3rd receptionist, Monica, was wonderful and went out of her way to be accommodating and helpful, always smiling and happy and no request a bother. Upon checking out, I learned that she was the owner- of course she cared.
reviews.title: an palazzo with the quality of a highway motel

reviews.text: We stayed at the charming Palazzo Squarcialupi for 3 days. We had a wonderful stay. The rooms were clean and well appointed. The staff were helpful and informative. The views were beautiful and the pool was great for a swim in the late afternoon. The palazzo is in an excellent location for exploring Tuscany.
reviews.title: Fabulous Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: LOCATION AND VIEWS-- BEST of both worlds. The front door is in the main town near all, the back is on hills with the pool, with farmland and vineyards as far as the eye can see.
reviews.title: Welcoming, family-like, Best of both worlds-location in town and in country

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: SERVICE-- Like staying with your grandmother. Warm, welcoming, loving. Not "5-star"-- no over-the-top "Yes madam", just really nice people who genuinely love the town, the hotel and their jobs.
reviews.title: Very charming hotel, we'll be back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For ex, they did not take our bags or show us to our room (although one of the maids helped) but, they opened a wine bottle and gave us glasses to drink wine in our room (no charge), treated me to a glass of wine when I said I needed it to calm my nerves before a curvy roadtrip, gave great advice on the area, and always had a smile.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I complimented the "owner" and said "I love your staff"- and she said- I am the staff! (the owner was out of town)
reviews.title: One of our favorite stops in the center of Tuscany

reviews.text: What a wonderful place. From Irene and Angela, the great front desk ladies. To the wonderful spa to the excellent terrace and pool!!! Our last 3 night in Italy were spent at this lovely establishment! We just escaped a horrible B&B with bugs, no locks on doors, toilet not working. We were very sad, discouraged then we stumbled upon Palazzo Squarcialupi. I can not say enough wonderful things about this hotel. It was clean, friendly, relaxing it just goes on and on. What a way to spend the last few days in Italy PERFECTO!!!!! Thank you for making our trip complete!
reviews.title: A diamond in Chianti!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place is another one of those wonderful old palaces with large rooms, high ceilings, interesting woodwork, hints of history everywhere. The bathroom was modern and comfortable with better water pressure than ours at home. Our room looked out over the hills and was probably quieter than those facing the street. The staff was very friendly and helpful, and even came to the computer to help when we had trouble doing our online check-in for plane reservations the following day. I’d love to return.
reviews.title: Combines historic charm and modern convenience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband & I stayed at the Palazzo Squarchilupi for a week with a large group of friends to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary. They were very accomodating for our group, setting up the terrace on nice days so we could enjoy the beautiful view while we chatted, and setting up the bar area for us when it was chilly. They were very accomodating and made sure we had everything we needed each night.
reviews.title: We will be back - this place was fantastic!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived on Saturday, which is Castellina's market day. The taxi couldn't drop us off at the hotel since the market was set up, but it was only a few blocks to the hotel. We dropped off our bags and went to the market to buy meat & cheese for lunch. We ate on the terrace and marvelled at the view. Our rooms were all different, which we loved. My husband & I had the room with the balcony and spent a lot of time out there. I wish I had that view at home! The rooms were very clean and well-maintained. I loved the heater in the bathroom wall next to the commode, I've never seen that before.
reviews.title: Excellent service and nice place
A very nice place to stay
reviews.text: Breakfast was ample, with meats, cheeses, hard boiled eggs, pastries, cereal and more. There was enough variety that you never had to eat the same thing every day.

aka: Palazzo Squarcialupi Hotel Castellina In Chianti
description: Situated in the heart of the historical center of Castellina in Chianti, you will find the 15th century Palazzo Squarcialupi. In the past, the Palace was a noble residence with agricultural activity and has recently been restored to become the Hotel Palazzo Squarcialupi.
